member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeDefaultConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration for accessing Amazon PersonalizeRuntime service

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeDefaultConfiguration.GetAllConfigurations
member.summary: Collection of all s supported by PersonalizeRuntime

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Internal.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeEndpointProvider
member.summary: Amazon PersonalizeRuntime endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of PersonalizeRuntimeEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Internal.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeEndpointProvider.ResolveEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.Endpoints.EndpointParameters)
member.summary: Resolve endpoint for PersonalizeRuntimeEndpointParameters

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Internal.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon PersonalizeRuntime endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for PersonalizeRuntime service requests. Collects values for PersonalizeRuntimeEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses PersonalizeRuntimeEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeRequest
member.summary: Base class for PersonalizeRuntime operation requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetActionRecommendations operation. Returns a list of recommended actions in sorted in descending order by prediction score. Use the GetActionRecommendations API if you have a custom campaign that deploys a solution version trained with a PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipe.
For more information about PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipes, see PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipes. For more information about getting action recommendations, see Getting action recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest.CampaignArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to use for getting action recommendations. This campaign must deploy a solution version trained with a PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipe.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The ARN of the filter to apply to the returned recommendations. For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.
When using this parameter, be sure the filter resource is ACTIVE.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when filtering recommendations. For each placeholder parameter in your filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include actions, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude actions, you can omit the filter-values. In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information, see Filtering recommendations and user segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest.NumResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumResults.
The number of results to return. The default is 5. The maximum is 100.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user ID of the user to provide action recommendations for.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetActionRecommendations operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsResponse.ActionList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionList.
A list of action recommendations sorted in descending order by prediction score. There can be a maximum of 100 actions in the list. For information about action scores, see How action recommendation scoring works.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsResponse.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetPersonalizedRanking operation. Re-ranks a list of recommended items for the given user. The first item in the list is deemed the most likely item to be of interest to the user.
The solution backing the campaign must have been created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.CampaignArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to use for generating the personalized ranking.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
The contextual metadata to use when getting recommendations. Contextual metadata includes any interaction information that might be relevant when getting a user's recommendations, such as the user's current location or device type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a filter you created to include items or exclude items from recommendations for a given user. For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when filtering recommendations. For each placeholder parameter in your filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include items, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude items, you can omit the filter-values.In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.InputList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputList.
A list of items (by itemId) to rank. If an item was not included in the training dataset, the item is appended to the end of the reranked list. If you are including metadata in recommendations, the maximum is 50. Otherwise, the maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.MetadataColumns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetadataColumns.
If you enabled metadata in recommendations when you created or updated the campaign, specify metadata columns from your Items dataset to include in the personalized ranking. The map key is ITEMS and the value is a list of column names from your Items dataset. The maximum number of columns you can provide is 10.
For information about enabling metadata for a campaign, see Enabling metadata in recommendations for a campaign.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user for which you want the campaign to provide a personalized ranking.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetPersonalizedRanking operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse.PersonalizedRanking
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PersonalizedRanking.
A list of items in order of most likely interest to the user. The maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingResponse.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetRecommendations operation. Returns a list of recommended items. For campaigns, the campaign's Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is required and the required user and item input depends on the recipe type used to create the solution backing the campaign as follows:
USER_PERSONALIZATION - userId required, itemId not used
RELATED_ITEMS - itemId required, userId not used
Campaigns that are backed by a solution created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING use the API.
For recommenders, the recommender's ARN is required and the required item and user input depends on the use case (domain-based recipe) backing the recommender. For information on use case requirements see Choosing recommender use cases.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.CampaignArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CampaignArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the campaign to use for getting recommendations.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.Context
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Context.
The contextual metadata to use when getting recommendations. Contextual metadata includes any interaction information that might be relevant when getting a user's recommendations, such as the user's current location or device type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The ARN of the filter to apply to the returned recommendations. For more information, see Filtering Recommendations.
When using this parameter, be sure the filter resource is ACTIVE.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when filtering recommendations. For each placeholder parameter in your filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include items, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude items, you can omit the filter-values.In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information, see Filtering recommendations and user segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.ItemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemId.
The item ID to provide recommendations for.
Required for RELATED_ITEMS recipe type.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.MetadataColumns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MetadataColumns.
If you enabled metadata in recommendations when you created or updated the campaign or recommender, specify the metadata columns from your Items dataset to include in item recommendations. The map key is ITEMS and the value is a list of column names from your Items dataset. The maximum number of columns you can provide is 10.
For information about enabling metadata for a campaign, see Enabling metadata in recommendations for a campaign. For information about enabling metadata for a recommender, see Enabling metadata in recommendations for a recommender.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.NumResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NumResults.
The number of results to return. The default is 25. If you are including metadata in recommendations, the maximum is 50. Otherwise, the maximum is 500.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.Promotions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Promotions.
The promotions to apply to the recommendation request. A promotion defines additional business rules that apply to a configurable subset of recommended items.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.RecommenderArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommenderArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommender to use to get recommendations. Provide a recommender ARN if you created a Domain dataset group with a recommender for a domain use case.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest.UserId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserId.
The user ID to provide recommendations for.
Required for USER_PERSONALIZATION recipe type.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetRecommendations operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse.ItemList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemList.
A list of recommendations sorted in descending order by prediction score. There can be a maximum of 500 items in the list.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsResponse.RecommendationId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RecommendationId.
The ID of the recommendation.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedAction
member.summary:
An object that identifies an action.
The API returns a list of PredictedActions.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedAction.ActionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionId.
The ID of the recommended action.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedAction.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
The score of the recommended action. For information about action scores, see How action recommendation scoring works.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem
member.summary:
An object that identifies an item.
The and APIs return a list of PredictedItems.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem.ItemId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ItemId.
The recommended item ID.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem.Metadata
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Metadata.
Metadata about the item from your Items dataset.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem.PromotionName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PromotionName.
The name of the promotion that included the predicted item.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.PredictedItem.Score
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Score.
A numeric representation of the model's certainty that the item will be the next user selection. For more information on scoring logic, see how-scores-work.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.Promotion
member.summary: Contains information on a promotion. A promotion defines additional business rules that apply to a configurable subset of recommended items.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.Promotion.FilterArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter used by the promotion. This filter defines the criteria for promoted items. For more information, see Promotion filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.Promotion.FilterValues
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterValues.
The values to use when promoting items. For each placeholder parameter in your promotion's filter expression, provide the parameter name (in matching case) as a key and the filter value(s) as the corresponding value. Separate multiple values for one parameter with a comma.
For filter expressions that use an INCLUDE element to include items, you must provide values for all parameters that are defined in the expression. For filters with expressions that use an EXCLUDE element to exclude items, you can omit the filter-values. In this case, Amazon Personalize doesn't use that portion of the expression to filter recommendations.
For more information on creating filters, see Filtering recommendations and user segments.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.Promotion.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the promotion.

member.name: P:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.Promotion.PercentPromotedItems
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PercentPromotedItems.
The percentage of recommended items to apply the promotion to.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.ResourceNotFoundException
member.summary: The specified resource does not exist.

member.summary: Constructs a new ResourceNotFoundException with the specified error message.

member.name: T:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient
member.summary: Implementation for accessing PersonalizeRuntime

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.GetActionRecommendationsAsync(Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetActionRecommendationsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Returns a list of recommended actions in sorted in descending order by prediction score. Use the GetActionRecommendations API if you have a custom campaign that deploys a solution version trained with a PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipe.
For more information about PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipes, see PERSONALIZED_ACTIONS recipes. For more information about getting action recommendations, see Getting action recommendations.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetActionRecommendations service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetActionRecommendations service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetActionRecommendations Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.GetPersonalizedRankingAsync(Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetPersonalizedRankingRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Re-ranks a list of recommended items for the given user. The first item in the list is deemed the most likely item to be of interest to the user.
The solution backing the campaign must have been created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetPersonalizedRanking service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetPersonalizedRanking service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetPersonalizedRanking Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.GetRecommendationsAsync(Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.Model.GetRecommendationsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Returns a list of recommended items. For campaigns, the campaign's Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is required and the required user and item input depends on the recipe type used to create the solution backing the campaign as follows:
USER_PERSONALIZATION - userId required, itemId not used
RELATED_ITEMS - itemId required, userId not used
Campaigns that are backed by a solution created using a recipe of type PERSONALIZED_RANKING use the API.
For recommenders, the recommender's ARN is required and the required item and user input depends on the use case (domain-based recipe) backing the recommender. For information on use case requirements see Choosing recommender use cases.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetRecommendations service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetRecommendations service method, as returned by PersonalizeRuntime.
member.exception: Provide a valid value for the field or parameter.
The specified resource does not exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetRecommendations Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.PersonalizeRuntime.AmazonPersonalizeRuntimeClient.DetermineServiceOperationEndpoint(Amazon.Runtime.AmazonWebServiceRequest)
member.summary: Returns the endpoint that will be used for a particular request.
member.param: Request for the desired service operation.
member.returns: The resolved endpoint for the given request.
